page.title: 07SHERSTON'S HOUSING STOCK
page.content: The pattern of housing in Sherston is{changing radically.}An attractive stone-built village means that as old cottages come on the market they are bought up by retired townspeople, modernised and{"gentrified"}until their market value is far beyond the reach of old village families, whose children have to move into flats in neighbouring towns. Even the new housing estates, with the high price of land, are aimed at middle class occupiers, who commute to Bristol and move on frequently. Council houses are now available for purchase by their tenants. Those which have been resold have gone to professional families, so less housing is available for low-income families. From being a well-balanced traditional community, the village risks becoming a geriatric{museum piece.
